items.sentence: I don't want to embarrass you in front of your friends.
I make it a point to shine my shoes before I go to bed.

I have an early memory of my grandmother darning socks.
I take a walk for exercise at least three times a week.
Tom can be a bit of a stickler when it comes to safety.
I need to buy a stapler and some other office supplies.
When I get up, the first thing I need to do is stretch.
I didn't have any problems getting through immigration.
Tom entered the room with a sheet of paper in his hand.
Did you think that the book I gave you was very useful?
The lawyer that Tom hired has a lot of wealthy clients.
Don't just say the first thing that comes to your mind.
I thought that I'd get an early start tomorrow morning.
Think of what you are reading while you are reading it.
I was lucky to find an apartment close to where I work.
I need to buy something from the store on the way back.
I finally found out where Tom spends all his free time.
Tom wasn't all alone in the house. Mary was there, too.
Let me tell you something that I think you should know.
